Flow Rate Predictions¶

Module for ARIMA modeling.

Classes:

Arima: contains functions to retrieve data and build ARIMA model for given river run

Functions:

get_data: retrieves needed data for selected run

daily_avg: takes time series with measurements on different timeframes and creates a dataframe with daily averages for flow rate and exogenous predictors

arima_model: creates flow rate predictions using statsmodel package functions

get_min_max: use get_all_runs function to query database and then pull min and max runnable flow rate for given run

class riverrunner.arima.Arima[source]¶

Creates predictions for future flow rate using ARIMA model

get_data(run_id, metric_ids=None)[source]¶

Retrieves data for selected run from database for past four years from current date using Repository.get_measurements function.

Parameters:
  • run_id (int) – id of run for which model will be created
  • metric_ids ([str]) – list of metric ids to include
Returns:

containing four years of measurements up to current date for the given run
Return type:

DataFrame
daily_avg(run_id)[source]¶

Creates dataframe needed for modelling

Calls Arima.get_data to retrieve measurements for given run and creates a dataframe with daily averages for flow rate and exogenous predictors.

Parameters:run_id (int) – id of run for which model will be created
Returns:containing daily measurements
Return type:DataFrame
arima_model(run_id)[source]¶

Creates flow rate predictions using ARIMA model.

Calls Arima.daily_avg to retrieve data for given run, then creates flow rate predictions by using statsmodels functions arma_order_select_ic and ARIMA. Three weeks of past flow rate data are also returned for plotting purposes.

Parameters:run_id (int) – id of run for which model will be created
Returns:containing time-series flow rate predictions for next 7 days and historical flow rate for past 21 days
Return type:DataFrame
get_min_max(run_id)[source]¶

Gets min and max runnable flow rate for river run to use for plots

Parameters:run_id – id of run for which model will be created
Returns:minimum and maximum runnable flow rate for river
Return type:levels
